reviews.review: Nice weapones in Half - Life.

i've recommended this game but it's only a half hearted recommendation. Yeah there's bits that are good and I did find it enjoyable but towards the end when certain types of enemies start spawning in groups it really sucked any enjoyment out of it and just became frustrating. Also the night vision is AWFUL and exactly the same colour as the crosshair. Ropes are terrible though I had figured them out sufficiently by the final section. I like this game as an expansion to Half Life main story that shows you a little of what's going on elsewhere but I can't actually tell you for definite what the story of this one was (as opposed to Blue Shift which is also just a little side story). Also G-Man continues to be annoying and lurking in windows whilst, idk, the entire floor collapses into a pool of radioactive waste and you have to escape fast, and G-Man is just there. Lurking. Staring.

tl;dr I realise I probably didn't like this game and I am probably not going to replay this game ever again but would recommend if Half Life is a thing you like and this is on sale.

It's good. The chapters blend together more than Half Life 1 (in that its really hard for me to tell where one chapter begins and another ends, like the original you could show me a screenshot and I could probably tell what chapter it's from, OF sorta blends together more)

Also it has way more weapon variety than 1, some people may like that more, others not, me personally I found it a tad bit too much like some weapons I barely ever used.

But overall it's another fun Half Life game.

I absolutely recommend you get this game IF IT'S ON SALE! I got this for HALF A DOLLAR. It was like 90% off and I got all the Half-Life 1 games for like 2 dollars. So, I suggest waiting for a sale to buy Opposing Force and/or Blueshift.

Continuing on, this was obviously a game made just to ride on the money train that was Half-Life 1, but if you don't take this game seriously at all, then it's just extremely funny and a good time all around. 

The boss is a little confusing so I consider taking the F5 and F6/F7? buttons into consideration. You're going to want to save and load alot in this game (same goes for every other Half-Life game)

No caben dudas de que Half-Life: Opposing Force es una espectacular expansión para uno de los mejores videojuegos de todos los tiempos. La labor que Valve le confió a Gearbox implicaba un gran peso, el de mantener los altísimos estándares de calidad de la saga, y la desarrolladora, sin la mano maestra de los talentos detrás de Half-Life, logró estar a la altura.
La obra que hoy me ocupa es divertida y presenta una historia que enriquece notoriamente tanto a los sucesos de la obra original, como al universo de la franquicia. Además, si tenemos en cuenta que esta fue una expansión independiente lanzada en 1999, algo muy poco habitual para aquella época, ya no caben dudas de que el hecho de que sea tan disfrutable aún en la actualidad la convierte en un fantástico producto.

1. Launch the game you are having problems with.
2. Click on 'Options'
3. Click on the 'Mouse' tab
4. There should be a checkbox with some text next to it saying 'Raw mouse input', tick it.
5. Your mouse should be able to freely move around.

I really enjoyed this addition to the original Half-Life! It has its bugs from time to time (which can be frustrating), but if you're willing to troop past those and get to the end of the campaign, you will not be disappointed! Adds more story to the original Half-Life game, and is a must-play for any Half-Life fan!
Adds so much more cool stuff to an already really fun game. Played it all in one run and i had a ball doing it.

Great expansion pack. I wish i played the Half-Life games sooner. These games are awesome and now i understand why people talk a lot about these games. I would recommend this and i would say its a 87% must buy.

First half of the game is a bit meh, you've seen it all before in Half Life, a few extra enemies, but they're easy to dispatch.

Then you get to We Are Not Alone and the expansion decides it's had enough of your nonsense and cranks the difficulty up but gives you a ton of cool stuff and locations to explore.

Go play it, but I warn you, it's not easy. On Hard. Cause I played it on Hard.

This expansion is basically Hunt Down the Freeman but released 20 years earlier.

There are some things this game nails, mainly in terms of game mechanics, such as adding climbable ropes or slightly expanding the squad system. There are also interesting new weapon concepts. Also the boot camp tutorial is extremely well done, and it's probably the highlight of the game.

Unfortunately for the expansion, all the new concepts are very poorly integrated. For example, climbable ropes appear maybe 2 or 3 times throughout the entire game. In another case, 2 new types of suit rechargers are teased in the tutorial, military and civilian, and I only saw the military recharger once (I didn't find a single civilian recharger).

Health and suit power pickups are very scarce, and you are often thrown into hordes of enemies. There's one section where you're in a pitch-black maze and are meant to face off against many miniboss-tier enemies, with no ammo or health pickups. On the very last level, you face off against hordes of black-ops, at which point i turned on noclip and godmode because I was tired of this.

At one point, multiple new weapons are introduced very close to each other, with little instructions on how to use them, so I finished the game with about 3 weapons I ended up never using. 

These complaints are just a very small slice of annoyances I had with the expansion. However, I don't feel like writing, so I'll stop here.

Blue shift is a much better expansion, go play that instead.
Recommended if you appreciate the other Half life games, just watch out for bugs.

This game was amazing. You get to play as a member of the HECU, they added in new guns and weapons to use, and the story is overall captivating. It was short, sweet, and too the point, with no sections that dragged on or overstayed their welcome like "On a Rail" in the original Half-Life. My only complaint is that dang, they didn't make more of this guy, Adrian Shephard! I wish we would know what really happened to him and know whether or not he is still in the Half-Life canon! But overall, this is so worth it! So, why aren't YOU playing it yet? GET THIS GAME!

Good game, much much harder than the original Half-life. Enemies are now spongier but you have more guns and firepower so that balances that out. Some levels can be considered dumb, unrealistic, and illogical nowadays but considering this game is from '99 it's tolerable. Boss battle is very lame though.

Silahları çok güzel olan bir oyun. Bu sefer karakterimiz Gordon değil, onu ve diğer canlıları öldürmeye giden asker Adrian. Bunlara özel seri oyunları çıksa tadından yenmez. 

Oyunu bitirdim de harika oyunmuş. Hele sondaki Boss harika olmuş kolayca yenemiyoruz çünkü. Normal Half Life'a göre daha sevecen askerlerimiz var. Fakat bu oyunda güvenlik görevlilerini, bilim adamlarını öldürmüyoruz. Black Ops adındaki askerler ve suikastçiler de bizi öldürmek için yollanıyor oyunda. Bu oyundaki silahlar çok eğlenceli bu arada. Alınmalı oynanmalı.

This game is full of variety in enemies, weapons, and environments.

[h1] Так нужно делать аддоны [/h1]
Opposing Force не пытается паразитировать на успехе оригинала, а наоборот развивает её идеи, добавляет много нового и искренне пытается быть хорошей игрой. Посудите сами:
1) Много нового вооружения, противников и геймплейных механик.
2) Раскрывает сюжет с обратной стороны конфликта.
3) Проходится как полноценная отдельная игра.
4) Ощущается как посвежевшая халва. Нет, OP не лучше оригинала, однако в нужной мере обновила все аспекты первой части.

Именно поэтому эта часть для меня является одной из лучших в серии.
It is good, and I had fun. I think you will also have fun if you buy this game!

After playing the disappointing Blue Shift I didn't have much hope for this. Both are developed by Gearbox after all.

I was absolutely blown away. This isn't just a fantastic Expansion, this takes base Half-Life's lore, and builds upon it exponentially in new and interesting ways. With many assets entirely unique to it and a thoroughly enjoyable campaign, It's no wonder this is regarded as "the only Half-Life expansion that's worth playing"

"Worth playing" is an understatement. In all seriousness, this might be better than the base game. I wouldn't bother with Blue Shift, but Opposing Force is an essential component to the original Half-Life experience.

9/10

An amazing expansion pack that adds even more depth and quality gameplay content to an already stellar game. Half-Life: Opposing Force refreshes gameplay tactics just enough to keep things varied and fresh, but still familiar for those who enjoy the base Half-Life game. Arguably one of the best PC expansion packs of all time. Would 100% recommend.
